author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Plus Two student of an aided school at Pallathur near here allegedly committed suicide by setting himself on fire on Tuesday after his Chemistry teacher chided him and a couple of other students for not doing assignment.

Police said that Sebastian Selvaraj, teaching Chemistry for Plus Two students at Arunachalam Chettiar’s Higher Secondary School, admonished M. Prakash (17) and a couple of other boys for lacking in the subject.

After he asked them to stand outside the classroom, Prakash went into the Chemistry laboratory and allegedly committed self-immolation after bolting the lab from inside, the police said.

He was believed to have doused himself with kerosene found inside the laboratory, the police added.

Collector S. Malarvizhi, Superintendent of Police Ziaul Haque and Chief Educational Officer (CEO) Senthivel Murugan visited the school and conducted an enquired with the Headmaster and the Chemistry teacher.

The SP said that the police had registered an FIR under Section 174 of the Code of Criminal Procedure (case of suicide) and after investigation, altered the case under Section 306 of the Indian Penal Code (abetment of suicide).

Preliminary enquiry revealed that the teacher slapped the victim in front of the whole class “after which, the whole episode has taken place,” the Collector told The Hindu .

The police said that the Chemistry teacher was arrested for abetting the suicide of the boy.

The Collector asked the Devakottai Sub-Collector to conduct an enquiry and present a report on Wednesday.

Meanwhile, the CEO said that it was for the school management to take further action against the teacher.
title: Student ends life in school
